definition: to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose
to take (after a struggle)/to wrest/to seize/to capture/to win (a trophy)
to fight over/to contest/to vie over
to seize the crown/fig. to win a championship/to win gold medal
to seize/to capture/to wrest control of
to deprive/to expropriate/to strip (sb of his property)
to take back (forcibly)/to recapture/to win back
to gain the upper hand by a show of strength

sentences.english: Have you invited us here in order to impoverish us? Is it not so?
sentences.chinese: 難道你們請了我們來，是要奪我們所有的麼？

sentences.english: I said, endeavoring to snatch the glass from his hand.
sentences.chinese: 我說，竭力想從他手裏奪過杯子。

sentences.english: Arashi yao four sisters to seize the hand had excited was awake all night.
sentences.chinese: 嵐麼四姐妹爲奪到手的軍馬興奮的徹夜未眠。

sentences.english: Each soldier had taken plunder for himself.
sentences.chinese: 各兵丁都爲自己奪了財物。

sentences.english: We must have effective control over the conquered landing place.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須對已奪的登陸場進行有效控制。

sentences.english: Olympics Begin In Style; Swimmer Takes 1st Gold.
sentences.chinese: 奧運會盛大揭幕泳將奪首枚金牌。

sentences.english: When the Israelites returned from chasing the Philistines, they plundered their camp.
sentences.chinese: 以色列人追趕非利士人回來，就奪了他們的營盤。

sentences.english: And the children of Israel returned from chasing after the Philistines, and they spoiled their tents.
sentences.chinese: 以色列人追趕非利士人回來，就奪了他們的營盤。

sentences.english: If someone takes your cloak, do not stop him from taking your tunic.
sentences.chinese: 有人奪你的外衣，連裏衣也由他拿去。

sentences.english: I caught the cat from behind. I took the fish out of the cat's mouth.
sentences.chinese: 我從後面抓住了它，把魚從它的嘴裏奪了回來。

sentences.english: He wrenched the bag from my hand.
sentences.chinese: 他猛地一下把包兒從我手中奪了過去。

sentences.english: They took their sheep, and their oxen, and their asses, and that which was in the city, and that which was in the field
sentences.chinese: 奪了他們的羊羣，牛羣，和驢，並城裏田間所有的。

sentences.english: I don't think Porter will win the cup this season, for my money; Mark has the best chance.
sentences.chinese: 要我說，這個賽季波特奪不了冠軍，馬克的希望最大。

sentences.english: Take honour from me, and my life is done.
sentences.chinese: 毀我清譽，即是奪我生命。

sentences.english: Thou hast ravished my heart, my sister, my spouse;
sentences.chinese: 我妹子，我新婦，你奪了我的心。

sentences.english: Captain seizes the gun and runs quickly down.
sentences.chinese: 上校奪過羅爾夫手中的槍，迅速跑開。

definition: a move/an action/in one move/at a stroke/in one go
to fight over/to contest/to vie over
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
to seize/to capture/to wrest control of
special glory/distinction/rare honor/one's laurels/it's a privilege (to meet you)
to seize the crown/fig. to win a championship/to win gold medal
to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards
